chainsaw.active.mathsaw — Mathing chainsaw¶

class chainsaw.active.mathsaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

mathing chainsaw

append(thing)¶

Insert thing after any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – one incoming thing
appendstart(thing)¶

Insert thing before any other incoming things.

Parameters:thing – one incoming thing
arguments(*args, **kw)¶

Assign any positional and/or keyword arguments to be used anytime the current callable or alternative callable is invoked.

as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode each incoming thing with the 'ascii' codec (regardless of its original type).

Parameters:errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
classmethod as_auto()¶

Switch to context where incoming things are automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to byte encode each incoming thing (regardless of its original type).

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for encoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_deque()¶

Set iterable wrapper to deque.

as_dict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to dict.

as_edit()¶

Switch to editing context where operations can be performed on incoming things from initial placement to final extraction.

as_frozenset()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenset.

as_frozenstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenstuf.

as_list()¶

Set iterable wrapper to list.

classmethod as_manual()¶

Switch to context where incoming things must be manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_many()¶

Switch to performing operations on each incoming thing as just one individual thing in a series of many individual things.

as_one()¶

Switch to performing operations on incoming things as one whole thing.

as_ordereddict()¶

Set iterable wrapper to OrderedDict.

as_orderedstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenstuf.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to set.

as_stuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to stuf.

as_truth()¶

Switch to evaluation context where the results of operations on incoming things determine which of two potential paths to execute. After exiting the evaluation context by invoking which, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of incoming things so further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

as_tuple()¶

Set iterable wrapper to tuple.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set iterable wrapper to unicode (str under Python 3) decode each incoming thing (regardless of its original type).

Parameters:
  • encoding – Unicode encoding (default: 'utf-8')
  • errors – error handling for decoding issues (default: 'strict')
as_view()¶

Switch to query context where the results of operations on incoming things queried. Upon exit from query context by invoking results or end, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of so that further operations can be performed on an unmodified baseline version.

average()¶

Collect average thing within an iterable.

balanced¶

If incoming and outgoing things are in balance.

clear()¶

Clear out everything.

clear_in()¶

Clear incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Clear outgoing things.

count()¶

Number of incoming things.

count_out()¶

Number of outgoing things.

end()¶

Return outgoing things, cleaning out everything afterwards.

extend(things)¶

Insert things after any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
extendstart(things)¶

Insert things before any other incoming things.

Parameters:things – incoming things
max()¶

Collect maximum thing within an iterable using the current callable as the key function.

median()¶

Collect median thing within an iterable.

min()¶

Collect minimum thing within an iterable using the current callable as the key function.

minmax()¶

Collect minimum and maximum things within an iterable as a tuple consisting of (minimum value, maximum value).

preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

range()¶

Collect length of the smallest interval that can contain each thing within an iterable.

results()¶

Return outgoing things, clearing outgoing things afterwards.

shift_in()¶

Manually copy outgoing things back to incoming things.

shift_out()¶

Manually copy incoming things to outgoing things.

snapshot(baseline=False, original=False, snapshot=True)¶

Take a snapshot of current incoming things.

Parameters:
  • baseline – make this snapshot the baseline snapshot (default: False)
  • original – make this snapshot the original snapshot (default: False)
sum(start=0, floats=False)¶

Collect total from adding up start and each thing within an iterable.

Parameters:
  • start – starting number (default: 0)
  • floats – add floats with extended precision (default: False)
tap(call, alt=None, factory=False)¶

Assign current callable. Optionally assign an alternative callable. If factory flag is set to True, use the callable passed with the call argument as a factory to build the current callable.

Parameters:
  • call – callable assigned as current callable
  • alt – callable assigned as alternative callable (default: None)
  • factory – whether call is a factory that produces callables (default: False)
undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things to a previous snapshot of incoming things.

Parameters:
  • snapshot – number of steps ago e.g. 1, 2, 3, etc. (default: 0)
  • baseline – revert incoming things to baseline snapshot ( default: False)
  • original – revert incoming things to original snapshot ( default: False)
untap()¶

Clear any current callable, alternative callable, or assigned position or keywork arguments.

unwrap()¶

Set iterable wrapper to list.

which(call=None, alt=None)¶

Choose current callable based on results of condition mode.

Parameters:
  • call – new callable to use if condition is True (default: None)
  • alt – new external callable to use if condition is False (default: None)
wrap(wrapper)¶

Set iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

Parameters:wrapper –

an iterable wrapper
